tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE air_quality_monitoring (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  area_name VARCHAR(50),
  pollutant_type VARCHAR(50),
  pollutant_level FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE AirQualityData (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    area_name VARCHAR(255),
    pollutant_type VARCHAR(50),
    reading_value FLOAT,
    reading_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE MonitoringStation (
    station_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    station_name VARCHAR(255),
    station_location VARCHAR(255),
    station_type VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE CityArea (
    area_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    area_name VARCHAR(255),
    population INT,
    pollution_level VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE AirQualityReading (
  reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  area_id INT,
  reading_date DATE,
  air_quality_index INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (area_id) REFERENCES Area(area_id)
);

CREATE TABLE City_Areas (
    area_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    area_name VARCHAR(255),
    population INT,
    city_district VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE Air_Quality_Reading (
    reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    area_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    pm_25 FLOAT,
    pm_10 FLOAT,
    o3 FLOAT,
    no2 FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (area_id) REFERENCES City_Areas(area_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Air_Quality_Standards (
    standard_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    pollutant_name VARCHAR(255),
    pm_25_standard FLOAT,
    pm_10_standard FLOAT,
    o3_standard FLOAT,
    no2_standard FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE Air_Quality_Alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    reading_id INT,
    alert_type VARCHAR(255),
    alert_message TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (reading_id) REFERENCES Air_Quality_Reading(reading_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Air_Pollution_Sources (
    source_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_name VARCHAR(255),
    source_type VARCHAR(255)
)
